name: 吳傳威
objective: The main purpose of the course is to familiar students with force method to analyze determinate structures, its contents include: (1)Introduction and history of structures, (2) Stability and indeterminacy of structures, (3) Shear and moment diagrams, (4) Analysis of plane trusses, (5) Influence lines and applications, (6) Elastic deformations of structures.
schedule:
1st week　　Introduction
2nd week　　Definition of structures, structural elements, historical remarks
3rd week　　Supports, statically equilibrium conditions
4th week　　Determinate and indeterminate structures, stability, free body
5th week　　Support reactions of determinate beams
6th week　　Shear and moment diagrams of determinate beams
7th week　　Shear and moment diagrams (Quiz #1)
8th week　　Analysis of simple and compound trusses – method of joint and section
9th week　　Analysis of complex trusses – method of circuit and substitute member
10th week　　 Midterm examination
11th week Influence lines for beams
12th week Influence lines for trusses
13th week Applications of influence lines
14th week Absolute maximum moment(Quiz #2)
15th week Deformation – slope and deflection
16th week Deformation -　　Conjugate beam method
17th week Elastic strain energy
18th week Final examination
materials:
1.Structural Analysis, 7th edition, R.C.Hibbeler.
2.Elementary Theory of Structures, 4th edition, Yuan-Yu Hsien, and Mau
